title: Titusville woman wounded after gift gun goes off
content:
A woman was hospitalized with serious injuries Tuesday morning after a loaded .22 caliber handgun given as a gift accidentally fired off a round into the thigh, Titusville police reported.
The unidentified woman apparently did not know the gun was loaded and was in the bedroom when she was struck in her right leg. The incident happened about 6 a.m. Tuesday at a house in the 2000 block of Karanda Street.
Brevard County Fire Rescue crews treated the woman’s injuries and transported her to Holmes Regional Medical Center in Melbourne. The woman, described as going in and out of consciousness, may have been wounded near an artery, reports show.
Titusville police are investigating the case.
